citation.article-title: Calderobacterium hydrogenophilum nov. gen., nov. sp., an extreme thermophilic bacterium and its hydrogenase activity.

p.s: Description of Calderobacterium hydrogenophilum sp. nov.
Long rods, O.35-0.5 by 2.0-3.0 to 8 μ.
Does not form carotenoid pigments and poly-β-hydroxybutyric acid.
Grows chemolithoautotrophically utilizing H2 as electron donor and CO2 as carbon source.
Utilizes ammonium salts and nitrates as sole nitrogen source.
Optimum temperature for growth is 74-76°C; lower temperature limit for growth is 50°C, and upper limit, 82°C.
G + C content of cell DNA is 39-41 mole %.
Isolated from samples of slimy growth and algobacterial mats of hot gas springs in Kamchatka (Geyser valley and the caldera of volcano Uzon).
Type strain: strain Z-829 is used as the type strain for the extremely thermophilic.
Obligately autotrophic hydrogen bacterium C. hydrogenophilum.

The type strain, together with other strains of this species, has been deposited in the collection of hydrogen bacteria of the Division of Lithotrophic Microorganisms at the Institute of Microbiology, Academy of Sciences of the USSR, under the numbers listed above.
